4.14.23  8:18 pm   pick a character

      i already did

4.14.23  5:59 pm   Where to find pickled melons?

      i have no earthly idea

4.14.23  5:04 pm   For "more than a dream" in the bit where it goes "dum dum dum woah dreams make sense ", am I right in saying you go to a 2-5-1 in F#major,

     yep

      but the second time round you go to Emin7 after the lyric "and the best days you'll beleive again"? .

     right

     Then going to an A major ish chord which would indicate that we're in Dmajor right?

     just about. it's like A7sus4. and yes, the key of the moment right there is definitely D

     But you go back to F anyway. I noticed that you also teased a movement to D earlier in the song. In the bit "I can't beleive what I'm seeing , it's more than a dream , it's more than anyone ever dreamed in history" where you go from gmaj7 to Amaj ,

     more like A7sus4, and yes, the key of the moment there is definitely also D

      somewhat suggesting a 4-5 movement relative to D,

     absolutely yes

      and resolving to D at that point would make sense to the ear

     UNLESS you've been listening to the song since the beginning

      yet somehow you manage to return to F and still get it to sound natural.

     yes. this is common and normal. especially considering that keys a minor 3rd apart from each other tend to be like ghost cousins. very easy to slip back and forth between the two

     I'm intrigued as to how you managed wander everywhere harmonically and end up at the same place as if you were never gone.

     to find the right moves, the writer really never knows what it's gonna be. for best results, almost like a sneeze, you have to almost forget your trying. you have to be very open to where the song wants to go. trying to tell the song where you want it to go will make no one happy. It's also quite common and normal for a song to find its way back to the same key as it was before, when returning to the same part. but you have to be open to whatever the song wants to do. Sometimes the song will easily yank back to F (if it was in F before). Other times, it may want nothing to do with F. And, of course, you have to also be open to not just the chords but, as always, the sum total of what the melody, chords, words, and any other context, is doing. that's the only way to really find where things go at any given time

     I also very much enjoy the Dbmaj7 to Ab maj7 vamp you managed to fit in, and if it isn't too much bother, what chords did u use to get from that vamp back to F major ? 

     on "anything" it's like Gmin7 possibly avoiding the D note. then Dmin to start the chorus as normal

4.13.23  9:04 pm   the original Super Mario underground theme is literally only a 12 second loop. How did they get away with this?

      they chopped off some empty spaces in the first 4 bars, which shortens it from what it would have been if the bars had been complete (like in the later versions with drums). and also, the levels are not very long. also, perhaps going so crazy on the last line probably makes up for the shortness. it'd probably take way more than 12 seconds for a person just to process all those crazy note choices in that final line. But i think the more important issue here is not so much 'how' but 'why' was it necessary, and the answer just comes down to technical limitations. surely they must have been working on an unimaginably tight computational budget, compared to today's standards. make every byte count. and when you truly have firm limitations, that's when the miracles just happen. because they have to

4.13.23  7:23 pm   yesterday i was in one of those big office spaces with various different businesses all taking space in different offices on different floors and all that, and i realized i enjoyed that space in largely the same way that i enjoy airports, and then i felt like i gained just a little more understanding of your work. can you explain this at least a little?

      i like office spaces too, maybe for the same reasons as you, or maybe for different reasons. maybe even for reasons i'm not sure about. but here are some reasons i can identify: i really like chairs. i like desks. i like doing work with computers. and also, offices are cleaned professionally, probably multiple times a week, so they are very clean. i also love rooms, halls, and stairs. office spaces usually have even more of those than the average house does

4.12.23  3:28 am   I cannot access anything that I really mean because it is all hidden under a sort of veil. I don't know when this veil appeared, but I hate it a lot. It is stopping me from understanding. I cannot help but wonder what would happen if it disappeared suddenly and the understanding was too potent for my mind. What if my head exploded with a "pop!"? 

      that is a legitimate concern
